ecosim.entity

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • ecosim.entity.Entity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IPaintable, IUpdatable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Animal, GrassTuft

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
implements IUpdatable, IPaintable
    The Entity class implements the methods from both IUpdatable and IPaintable. It contains a BufferedImage which will be painted to the window in the paint method. It contains a BoundingBox, which determines the image's position and size. The Entity has an abstract update method which will need to be defined in any descendant classes. If this object is added to the GameEngine using GameEngine.add(obj), its paint method and update method will be called automatically 60 times per second. The Animal class in your EcoSim should extend from this class so that any of its descendants can also be drawn to the screen automatically.
    Author:
    Michael

    • Field Detail

      • image

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage image
        Will be painted in the paint method.

      • bounds

        protected BoundingBox bounds
        Determines the position and size of the image that is painted in the paint method.

      • target

        protected Vector2D target
        The location for this object to move its bounds towards. This should be handled in an overridden update method. This object can be null. All methods should check for a null target before accessing its methods or variables.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Entity

        public Entity(float x,
              float y,
              java.awt.image.BufferedImage image)
        Constructs an Entity at the given x and y position. The given image will determine what is painted to the screen in the paint method. The Entity and image will have the default size, which is equal to Tile.WIDTH and Tile.HEIGHT.
        Parameters:
        x - the x coordinate of this Entity's top left corner.
        y - the y coordinate of this Entity's top left corner.
        image - the image to display at that location.

    • Method Detail

      • getX

        public float getX()
        Gets the x coordinate of the top left point of the bounds.
        Returns:
        the x coordinate.

      • getY

        public float getY()
        Gets the y coordinate of the top left point of the bounds.
        Returns:
        the y coordinate.

      • getBounds

        public BoundingBox getBounds()
        Gets a reference to this object's BoundingBox.
        Returns:
        a reference to this object's BoundingBox.

      • getPosition

        public Vector2D getPosition()
        Gets a deep copy of the top left corner of this object's BoundingBox. You can also get a reference to the position using this.getBounds().getPosition().
        Returns:
        a copy of this object's BoundingBox's top left position.

      • setTarget

        public void setTarget(Vector2D target)
        Sets the target coordinates of this Entity. This object should move its position towards its target in the Entity's update method. setTarget() stores a reference to the given Vector2D which means if that Vector2D's x and y coordinates are updated or changed, this Entity will have access to the updated coordinates.
        Parameters:
        target - the Vector2D for this object to move towards.

      • getTarget

        public Vector2D getTarget()
        Gets a deep copy of the target Vector2D.
        Returns:
        a copy of the target.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Returns whether this Entity is alive and able to act.
        Returns:
        true if the object should be updating.

      • die

        public void die()
        Sets alive to false and removes this object from the GameEngine. This cannot be undone.

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints the object's image to the MainWindow at the location of this object's bounds, with the same size as this object's bounds. If this object is added to the GameEngine, this method will automatically be called 60 times per second.
        Specified by:
        paint in interface IPaintable
        Parameters:
        g - a graphics context for drawing images, text and primitive shapes to a javax.swing component.
